The dates ""28/12/90 to 6/1/91"" is displayed at the bottom right hand side. A picture of a woman wearing a kebaya and sitting down on a chair in the interior of a building can be seen." "The image displays the front cover of a magazine. It is grey in colour. ""Open Space"" is displayed at the top. The dates ""28/12/90 to 6/1/91"" is displayed at the bottom right hand side. A picture of a woman wearing a kebaya and sitting down on a chair in the interior of a building can be seen."
sgcool_label_text:
The inaugural issue of Open Space, a bi-monthly bilingual magazine with events and reviews which ran till December 1992. This important issue documents the launch of the Substation, perhaps the definitive independent art space in Singapore. 

With a forward by its founder Kuo Pao Kun and featuring images and events of its different functioned spaces, the issue also features a rare full-colour centrefold collage by Joe Ng, a local music archivist of a gig in what was then the Substation’s open air garden. Open Space was distributed for free at the Substation’s Box Office. The inaugural issue of Open Space, a bi-monthly bilingual magazine with events and reviews which ran till December 1992.
